page.title: 18THE CONSERVATION VILLAGE
page.content: the present village by Alexander the 9th Earl of Eglinton who gave each villager a "lang rigg " of land and stone from his quarries to build a substantial house .By the 1940s many houses were condemed and bulldozing was threatened. Then in 1953 the preservation society was formed, the county gave grants and interest free loans to refurbish the houses.Property in the conservation village became very expensive .Local people were unable to afford them and outsiders moved in. During European heritage year the E.E.C gave money to put all the service cables underground. Conservation has made the village centre so attractive that many day trippers come to visit especially at weekends and fine summer days.
